TopicTitle: Just finished my first Sandbox Munar Apollo-style mission in v1.0

Articles.Content:
I just finished my first Sandbox Munar Apollo-style mission in v1.0.

Forgot to take a snapshot at launch. The first stage was composed of that 3200 4-cluster with two side boosters (2-cluster).

![fOzk0fm.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/fOzk0fm.jpg)

Second stage fires. You see the new fairings in place, covering and protecting the part of the stack where my LM is located.

![f50V58O.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/f50V58O.jpg)

Halfway through second stage.

![NFgcVNX.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/NFgcVNX.jpg)

Fairing jettison.

(forgot to take snapshots of arrival at Munar orbit, sorry)

![WLKUa0n.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/WLKUa0n.jpg)

LM separating from the 3rd stage which also acted as a braking stage

![P83BA4B.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/P83BA4B.jpg)

LM about to land, nice dust effects

![8BpuChJ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/8BpuChJ.jpg)

Jeb doing a clambering demo

![jv3wIAb.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/jv3wIAb.jpg)

Meanwhile, back at the CSM, Bill checks up on the new fuel cells

![MyHkUpR.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/MyHkUpR.jpg)

Jeb and Bob celebrating their first Mun landing with KSP v1.0

![O9diXM5.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/O9diXM5.jpg)

Great shot of LM ascent stage leaving the LM descent stage and munar surface

![nc7doll.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/nc7doll.jpg)

Rendezvous and docking with the CSM

![Sr1j9g4.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Sr1j9g4.jpg)

Nearly there. I do docking purely "by eye"

![ZYquqmV.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ZYquqmV.jpg)

Trans-Kerbin burn

![ikopZ50.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ikopZ50.jpg)

Trans-Kerbin coast

![wGiU7H2.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/wGiU7H2.jpg)

Re-entry heating

![0YhddEU.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/0YhddEU.jpg)

Heat shield in action

![hnbr86g.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/hnbr86g.jpg)

Chutes deployed

![ve1e8Sb.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ve1e8Sb.jpg)

Splashdown

My main complaint is a drastic reduction of FPS (which some said might be because v1.0 reset my GFX settings, so will look into that), but as you can see, this low FPS didn't hinder my mission.

All-in-all, as you can probably see, I am enjoying KSP v1.0 ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-27T21:52:01Z" title="04/27/2015 09:52  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 27, 2015</time> by rodion\_herrera**
